description: To the best of my knowledge, the best music tag manager out there. It is extremely flexible while being user friendly, and unlike some other programs it actually makes editable all tags embedded in a file.

This app is great! I was a longtime user of mp3tag on Windows, and this is very similar to it. Once you get a workflow down, it'll be a huge time saver.

My only qualms so far are some minor interface issues, but overall, it's still a handy app.

If you are looking for the most options, and an incredibly powerful audio tag editor, Puddletag will meet your needs and expectations. Loads fast and is extremely customizable. If you're a novice, you should be just fine, and if you really know your stuff, you'll be super pleased with all the options and what this lightweight piece of software can actually do, and very quickly!

I tried a few others before Puddletag, and I really like this one the best!

I have to say it's still not quite as good as Mp3tag for Windows (particularly it doesn't seem to have a preview function for the Tag -> Filename converter). But it's 99% there. My favourite music tagging app for Linux.

No podía abrir archivos en discos externos y USB desde el programa. Para abrir los archivos de estos discos, abrimos el directorio correspondiente, seleccionamos todos los archivos y seleccionamos "abrir con Puddletag". Para mi es el mejor editor de etiquetas para MP3 y MP4.
summary: Abrir archivos en discos externos y USB

description: No se puede acceder a los discos auxiliares ni USB.
